text: 1st time here and the food is awesome.  Mongolian is the best.  We had Family C dinner but we ordered Walnut shrimp instead.  Good size shrimp and the walnut sauce is what I expected.  Salt and pepper pork chops is my favorite.   It reminds me of this family chinese place we used to go in Long Beach,  CA.  Fish with black bean sauce was good also.  I wasn't too crazy about the appetizer,  BBQ ribs,  it was a lil tough.   Defintely going back to this place.  No need to drive to Spring Mountain. ..close to our home in Henderson.

Best Chinese food in Las Vegas . I tried a bunch of other places and no one compares to this place. The price was great and $30 fed my whole family . Delivery was fast and the delivery guy was very nice and efficient. The best fried rice I have ever tasted , it was so moist and perfect . The egg rolls were huge and crispy on the outside and fresh veggies inside . Beef chow mein was fresh and had big moist tender pieces of beef in it and the noodles were cooked perfect . Family loved the orange chicken too . This is my new number one place to eat out at in Vegas now .

I've been searching great Chinese for a long time. My husband and I go to a new Chinese place a week to search. We finally found one we really like. This place is great. They even have signs up showing the awards they've won, and they've earned them. They're general gao's chicken is one of the best I've found anywhere. It's light and crispy and doesn't have a heavy sauce weighing it down. The rice is perfect and flavorful. The crab rangoons are good too. The egg rolls were good but not my favorite. My friends really enjoyed their chow mein and shrimp and broccoli. The broccoli was perfectly cooked and there was plenty of shrimp as well. It was hot and fresh, not something that sat around for a while. The ultimate best part is if you come before 3pm the lunch specials are suppppper cheap. Give this place a try.
Moo Shu pork is amazing! I found this place on yelp and would definitely recommend it to a friend! Huge portions and great price!

Used to go here once a week for lunch, food was ok but had great service. Went today and found out they had fired the excellent friendly waitress that worked there for a long time, and instead kept a new  "friend of the owner's wife" waitress. They just lost my business.

I don't know how this place gets so many good reviews - my only thought is that most of those reviews are from people who get take out.  

The waitress was very friendly and the portions are generous, it doesn't make up for the fact that the broccoli in my food was way overcooked and the rice was still crunchy.  

But my main complaint about this restaurant is that it is DIRTY!  I moved the salt shaker to make more room on the table and I could feel the layers of dust and grease on it.  The bathroom was beyond description.

I will not go there again and I would recommend everyone else stay away as well.

I have gone here for lunch a few times and every dish I have tried has been exceptional. I always order the wonton soup along with the lunch special. Delicious. The flavors make this Chinese food the best I've ever had.

This is our new Chinese spot! Wow, all the dishes are AMAZING. I'm always hesitant on trying new restaurants, especially Chinese ones cause they can be either too greasy or just bad all together. But this place definitely is on point EVERY time. We liked it so much that we wanna make it a weekly treat. The orange chicken, sweet and sour chicken and lemon chicken are my favorites. Yummy!! :) ---- it's a MUST visit!

I've been here a few times . Ended up going the other night and the food was amazing . One of my girlfriends Chinese food spots had closed down. Golden flower will now be out new spot . Great service amazing food.
This place is the best chinese cruisine I've ever been to! Everything I've eaten so far like the delicious orange chicken and healthy wonton soup had been great and the prices are cheap.

Came here once before and dined in (in my pre yelp days) and it was great. Been searching for a good go to Chinese place since I moved from NY and this one certainly met the mark.

Food: had the sesame chicken, hot and sour soup, she had the chicken chow mein, and pot stickers. Chicken was just crispy enough without being burnt and not slimey by any means. Hot and sour soup was very good, had a good spice to it, although I wouldn't have minded a bit more. Her chicken chow mein was delicious, cooked perfectly an had great seasoning to it.

Staff: very friendly, talked to us a bit and were very attentive. 

Ambiance: just how I remember my favorite Chinese place in NY, has the retro feel with the Chinese New Year calendars as a placement. 7 booths and 3 tables.

All in all, I can't wait to come back and get more Chinese again! Where have you been the past 2 years of my life!

*update - ordered take out today. Staff was great and it didn't take too long to wait (I just walked in and didn't call ahead - kind of a last minute decision). Food was great as usual. They were able to prepare the pot stickers steamed instead of fried. I tried the shrimp low mein, and it was amazing. Noodles were cooked perfect and shrimp tasted fresh. I will continue to come here always hurray!

Took 2 hours and 25 minutes to get a cold Pu Pu platter. Never again.  

The shame of it all is that they were aware that I "Was" a regular customer. It will not be hard to find something better.
I love this place. I come here all the time. Best Chinese food in Vegas and the lunch specials are awesome. Huge portions of great food and less that $10 a person.

So we found this spot by the house. Came first for dine in. Small restaurant but that is why we like it. I dislike crowded restaurants.  I like to be able to enjoy my meal. 

Looks like a lot of the business is take out too. We have now ordered here twice in the last week.  Still miss my Chinese food style from Hawaii but these guys are good!  This has become my go to place.
I ordered the garlic chicken dinner special, so good, they packed the take out container, it was so much food! Saved half for later :)

I gave this restaurant three stars because they made some of the best Chinese food take-out I've had in Vegas, but that's not to say it was very good... For some reason Vegas has really terrible Chinese food and I'm usually relieved if I don't get food poisoning from it. In New York and Fort Lauderdale there is some AMAZING Chinese food and the delivery guy will get to you in ten minutes even if it is pouring rain outside. Anyway, if I was grading this place based on all of the Chinese food I've ever had I would give it two stars. If I were grading on a curve (since we are in Vegas) I'd give it about 3 and a half stars. I decided to rate it in the middle as a result.

Now let's breakdown the food: my girlfriend and I ordered the Poo Poo Platter as well as the Kungpow Shrimp and the Broccoli Beef. The Poo Poo Platter consisted of Crab Ragoons that were 90% cream cheese. Meh. The Egg Rolls were good smothered in chili garlic sauce and soy sauce, but they were some of the greasiest things I've ever eaten. Then there was a sweet pork thing on a skewer, not a ton of meat on it and I just wasn't a fan. There was this weird piece of chicken wrapped in tinfoil that seemed like it was baked in soy sauce and it was DELICIOUS. My favorite part of the whole meal. I would eat that again.The shrimp in the Kungpow Shrimp was good, but everything else kind of sucked. There was a ton of waterchesnuts in the Kungpow Shrimp and I hate waterchesnuts, but there was also a ton of undercooked zucchini that gave the dish a really crunchy texture. Ew. Also, the sauce on the kungpow shrimp wasn't even spicy. Maybe they gave me the wrong dish? I don't know. The beef in the broccoli beef was chewy and the sauce was sweet. My girlfriend liked it, but I didn't. I did like the Broccoli Beef better than the Kungpow Shrimp though. Also, the Broccoli Beef didn't heat up well and I didn't even bother to eat the Kungpow Shrimp.

I'm really surprised that this place has such amazing reviews. I may have gotten a crappy meal because I ordered right before they closed, but I asked if that was okay and the woman on the phone said yes. If she had said no it wouldn't have been a problem and I would've just called somewhere else. I am not impressed and I'm not ordering from Golden Flower again. I'll be going out of state for my Chinese food from now on.
Great food. There are not too many restaurants where you walk in and they are making wontons by hand right in front of you. Very reasonable priced too.
Great little place for lunch.. small so go before 12.  Simple menu nothing crazy and its served quick.

After reading the reviews we had high hopes, but they weren't met.  The service was friendly, attentive and prompt.

We tried the following:
Tempura shrimp = tasty, light and perfectly cooked.
Eggrolls = okay tasting but extremely greasy (HOT oils down the chest when biting into one not the best experience.)
Kung POW Chicken = okay flavor but overrun with cheap filler of zucchini and the peanuts tossed over the top as an after thought not cooked in to pick up the flavors.
Shrimp Fried Rice = Shrimp cooked perfectly however the rest was flavorless; plain rice with barely any color, white onions and egg.

We checked this into the "well we tried it" category but won't be back.  :(

I'd say this place is pretty standard on what you'd expect from a Chinese restaurant. We ordered one of their dinner packages last night, knowing our 2 small children would pick off what we had. The total with tax was $29.00 and came with a HUGE amount of food! My husband really liked everything we got. Mongolian beef, sweet and sour shrimp, special fried rice, BBQ ribs, egg rolls, wonton soup, and fried shrimp.  It was a lot! My kids love wonton soup, but seemed more interested in the crunchy toppings. I wasn't a big fan of the sweet and sour shrimp as it had too much batter for my taste. So much batter - the shrimp resembled onion rings. Lol! Their fried rice was enormous, and I'd definitely order it again.  

I saw that they had duck, and mu shoo, among other things. As a former employee of PF Changs, I grew to really like these particular items that for some odd reason they do not serve anymore. So, I'll be back to this particular Chinese restaurant to try theirs. I do love a good duck!

I think the food here is pretty good for the most part.  I don't care for the service, particularly when I order take out.  It really annoys me when I have to repeat my order a couple of times on the phone because the server or whoever it is that is on the phone, isn't listening/paying proper attention.  I usually come there or order take out for their roast duck

Went looking for a place near Fern Adair to take my children to right after dance class and found this place on the walking score site website and then checked to see what Yelpers thought of it.  Seemed to have decent reviews so we went there this evening.

It was really good.  I have to say the service was top notch.  I guess we got there just after 6:00 PM so at first I thought the service was so good because there were not that many other customers there.  But the place started filling up and they still kept up just fine.  Service was just super the whole time.  

We ordered just standard Chinese restaurant fare - sweet and sour pork, house fried rice, chicken teriyaki, house special chow mein.  It was all just really good, basic Chinese food, cooked fine, and tasty.  Also had won ton soup and it was particularly delicious.  The prices were quite reasonable.

Glad to have found a neat place we can stop by after dance class when we are too busy to cook at home.  Plus the place just seemed comfortable; a nice place to relax as well.

Liked it a lot.  Yummy food and perfectly nice service.

Pretty good food.  The orange chicken was a bit TOO sweet, but I am partially responsible for not asking for hot oil.  Egg rolls are fresh, and their pork fried rice is spot on.  Probably the best chinese joint in the east valley.

I can't believe how tender the beef is in their Beef Chop Suey. I also can't believe how Chinese restaurants put spaghetti in their Chow Mein where on the East coast Chow Mein is just vegetables plus meat served over hard Chow Mein noodles such as you would find in a can at the grocery store. Another crazy thing is white syrupy Lobster Sauce where on the East coast it is made from ground pork and spices. All in all the Golden Flower has kept us happy with their consistant good meals for the past year we have been here.

I am a Chinese food lover.  I saw the reviews for this restaurant and I was compelled to dine here one night.  The place is small and quaint. I am a big hole in the wall supporter and this place is in a empty mostly closed down remnants of what used to be a lively shopping center. 

For the food.  The menu is very simple and not extensive.  It is mostly Americanized popular dishes. I as not impressed. The people were nice and the service was good.  I just thought that the menu did not have enough selections and diversity and the food was not authentic enough.  

I'm not a fan. I doubt that I would be back.

I moved to Las Vegas in November 2014 from the East Coast and I immediately started looking for a good Chinese food place.  I have tried over 10 different place here in Vegas because when I order Shrimp egg foo young I like it with gravy not some kind of sauce that most places use of here.  Golden Flower was the first place that used this nice creamy gravy for my shrimp egg foo young, that I actually extra gravy on the side.  I always order beef chow mein, Shrimp fried rice (dark) and Shrimp egg foo young.  The shrimp are large not these popcorn shrimp that other places serve you.  If you are from the east coast and love that corner Chinese food spot then this is the place for you.  You will not be disappointment with the price or the food.

This is a great low-key place to go when you need some tasty Chinese food.  We came for lunch and ordered a pair of the very economical lunch specials.  The meats (chicken & BBQ pork) and veggies tasted fresh and sodium levels were fine (much lower than most Chinese restaurants).  The service was spot on, quiet and efficient.  We didn't eat the various fried wheat items that came with our plates, but there was plenty of nicely steamed rice to fill our starch needs.

So me and the wife were craving some good Chinese food yesterday and really not happy with the places fairly close to us at the top of Anthem. China joy,china gogo, Panda, and the trendy fake "Chinese Bistro" PF Chang's.
So went on Google and typed in "best Chinese food south east Las Vegas".. And Golden Flower popped up on Yelp! With 17 Reviews and 4 Solid stars so I thought id give it a try. After pulling in at the East Russel and Pecos address I thought this is pretty ghetto in a run down crappy strip mall. But a beacon of Hope appeared in the form of the golden flower! LOL  It was the only nice looking place in the strip mall with a nice looking store front and a menu of today's specials right out front.. Walked in and was told to sit where ever i want! That's a plus! No being guided to the table in the middle of the room.. 
The service was on par with almost perfect and not the desperate for tips feeling you get with some places where they check on you every 30 seconds. We started with the Teriyaki chicken sticks and wow they really delivered! Then went on with the Walnut Shrimp with Chicken fried rice and Kung Pao Chicken with steamed rice.. Im Knocking a star do to the food not being brought to the table all together. To much time in between dishes. Fried rice 20 minutes before an entree? really? But over all a really good place to get some great Chinese food $37 for 2 people not including tip.. Next time just going to order one rice cause they bring you Alot of rice on one order..

I have never had a bad meal here.  They have a great selection of Chinese food for any appetite.  I have never found potstickers as good as the ones at Golden Flower. I highly recommend this jewel of a restaurant in Las Vegas! Great food and great service!

Best Chinese in town!!! The lemon chicken is so good! Everything here is fantastic. It's this little hole in the wall but the service people could not be even sweeter. Everything is fresh tasting and the batter on the chicken is remarkable. I'm in love.
Good food and service. Was really quite when first got there. Filled up by time we left plus couple of pickups  they deliver too.

The food is a 4.5. The service is a 1.  Some of the waitresses act like you are bugging them when you walk-in and don't have a party of 5.  I still sometimes go because the food is great. Kudos to the cook!

I hate to knock family businesses but 2 out of 3 experiences were bad. First time was good. Food was ok, nothing to rave about. I got delivery. Service was cool, they delivered pretty quick.

 Second time I called, the lady on the phone was snappy, like she was in a rush to take my order. Okay that's fine, maybe I caught her at a bad time. I didn't even bother ordering.

Today, the third time. I didn't even get service. She answered the phone and had me hold, which was okay but I heard her taking other people's order. Followed by greeting patrons and seating them. She didn't even come back to the phone. Ugh!

Really...four stars?. Come on. Although they give a ton of fried rice, it was very dry without much flavor. I'm pretty sure they freeze it and reserve it because it definitely did not taste fresh. The pot stickers were terrible and had a plastic bag, freezer kind of taste. Panda Express, which I don't like, had better pot stickers. The sizzling rice soup was decent with a ton of meat but a bit on the salty side so I watered it down. I can't believe this place got the Las Vegas Journal's best Chinese restaurant. The people that voted for them must be the same people that voted Red Lobster as the best restaurant in Las Vegas!

This is without a doubt our favorite Chinese restaurant in Las Vegas.  Every time we go there the food is terrific and the service is top notch.  They always take time to chat with us and even always remember what my husband and I like to drink

Best Chinese Food in Vegas!!  Period!!!  I have been searching high and low for authentic Chinese food in Vegas for years. I finally found it at Golden Flower after a friend referred me here. Hidden gem and great BBQ fried rice. Soups are also great. When you are craving authentic classic Chinese sit down or carry out. This is the place!  Whole in the Wall. Don't let it fool you.  Thank you Golden Flower

We decided to do takeout when we ordered from this restaurant. When it got home, we could tell they overstocked each styrofoam box to the peak with as much food as possible, causing it to spill and stick everywhere.

The rice was probably the best part about the food - both fried and steamed. It was the right moisture and texture.

The sesame chicken was pretty decent - the sauce tasted good, but it was outnumbered by too many vegetables, undermining its name. The general tso's chicken was not a typical "general tso's" look or taste. There was hardly any spice and there was barely any sauce or seasoning applied. The sesame chicken was good, but pretty soggy, which took away from the taste and texture.

The lo mein was very rubbery and "artificial." It tasted as if it had just been pressed from a plastic mold from a factory.

Overall, we were not completely impressed with the food, but also understand and recognize that our experience was solely based on the takeout food. Dining inside the restaurant could be a completely different experience, and one must try it for his/herself.

Update June 10th, 2017: A few family members have become ill the next morning after eating; there's a possibility that food poisoning has occurred. Proceed with caution.
Being coming here for over 15yrs one of the best cheap Chinese food places in Las Vegas always clean and friendly and of course the food is amazing.

First time here as it was highly recommended - I definitely wasn't disappointed! Generous portions and attentive wait staff. Started with cheese puffs (pretty basic but still delicious) and moved on to Mongolian Beef with extra veggies, skipping the crunchy rice noodles they would normally put at the bottom. The beef was tender and flavorful. It had a good spicy kick that made my nose run a bit but in the "this is really tasty spicy!" way. 5 stars all the way!
Excellent, authentic Chinese restaurant. Reminds me of NY. Great service, good prices & tastes great.

The service was friendly and reasonably fast. HOWEVER, this was damn near the worst Chinese food I have ever had.... it tasted and appeared as if the food had been sitting out for DAYS. After 3 bites, my famine did not matter- the "food" was in the trash. If you value your intestine do not go here.

This was the first time i have eatten at Golden Flower Chinese and the food and service was excellent.
I am so glad we were able to have dinner here.
My wife and I recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for good chinese food food.
Best Chinese I've found in four states. Egg Flower Soup is divine and whatever the Silver Wrapped Chicken is so good you'll want to snort it.

We ordered Take-Out on Christmas Eve. I would say the menu is small for a typical Cantonese restaurant, just the basics (actually I didn't see Twice Cooked Pork or Shrimp with Lobster Sauce which I think of as Cantonese staples). Anyway, we got the House Special Egg Foo Young, House Special Fried Rice, Lemon Chicken and War Wonton Soup. We always compare new places to what we are used to from Detroit and they did not disappoint. The food was awesome and the portions are very generous. Leftovers amazing too!! We were actually commenting days later about how good the food was, this place is a keeper. Service was very nice and our food was prepared quickly. We will return for the dine-in experience. We really enjoyed our food and highly recommend Golden Flower!!! Very family friendly too!

This place has become a place that my husband and I meet for lunch since it's close to my job. A fellow yelper advised me to try the place said it was amazing. We have been 3 times and the food and service is good. Their egg flour soup is a great way to start your meal. It is seasoned and made perfectly with the right balance. I like the sesame chicken, it's always fresh and never disappoints my pallet. My husband gets one of their shrimp dishes and he is always satisfied with the taste and portion of shrimp. I have been in search of good Chinese restaurants since we moved to vegas 2.8 years ago and this one goes to the top of my list. The staff are very friendly and attentive, my glass is never empty and they always box up my leftovers which is nice. The restaurant is small and cozy and they keep it clean. I would recommend if you are in the area to give this place a try.
Pretty damn good. Not many authentic Chinese food places in town that aren't "fast food". I got the family dinner option C. Every item was delicious.
Food is good, nothing special. Standard american-chinese food. The staff are always very nice nice.
This place is good ! I been looking for a good Chinese place for a long time and I finally found one and not to mention there prices are great !!

Ok I rarely give 5 stars and The Golden Flower earned it. I will even go on and state that it's in my top 3 best Chinese restaurants I've had in Vegas. What did it for me was the extremely well seasoned dishes. I had the Sizzling Beef and my girlfriend had the Beef Chow Fun. We also had Wonton Soup. I liked the flavor of the beef on the Sizzling and liked the Chows noodles a lot. No doubt, I will return many times. PS: If you read this Golden Flower, please don't change. Keep this up.

We have ordered here before with no issues. That said, tonight the food was disgusting. Delivery was quick and the order taker was pleasant, but we will not be ordering here again. The beef in the fried rice was old, the sweet and sour chicken was soggy and old, and the fried wonton was the worst I have had... ever. My husband was very unhappy. My dog didn't even want the chicken (he eats EVERYTHING). This place is hit and miss, I am not willing to risk it again.

Outstanding lunch special that is served up quick by super friendly staff.
 
My personal favorite is the General chicken with fried rice and Wonton soup.  The pieces of chicken are all white meat.  Not pieces of chicken parts but ALL WHITE MEAT.

For an added bonus give the pot stickers a try.

With drink, less then $8 out the door.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: Vegas-Voyager approved! Nice venue, quality/tasty product, excellent entrée portion-to-price, 85% 4 & 5-star reviews, RJ's Best of LV Chinese in 2002, 2008 & 2012. How could putting your chips down on a meal here be a sucker bet?

The venue is small, quaint, unpretentious, well-kept, neatly-appointed. A sit-down restaurant. A family operation. Certainly not a breath-taking venue, not FIRST-date quality, but certainly later-date quality. You can take your family, friends, bf/gf, co-workers here without the embarrassment you might feel picking up the tab at a more typical "wok-u-up take-out" joint. 

The space is very small (pictures uploaded). There are nine nice burgundy faux-leather 4-top booths, two matching 6-top corner/curved burgundy banquettes and three free-standing small 4-top tables in the center. That's it. Small. Guess that keeps the rent down - allowing for high-quality & high-portioning.

I dined under the dinner menu. WonTon soup $2.25. (This portion was a wee bit small ... and was a good bit shy of the incredibly mouth-watering photographs of their WonTon posted by other Yelpers). Two good-sized crispy egg rolls ($3.50). Ginger Beef in Oyster Sauce, $10. Dinner entrées can be upgraded to 'a meal' with egg drop soup (or egg roll) & pork fried rice for $2. 

The portion of the beef entrée was enormous, four servings, enough for two. Big bowl of white rice on the side, comp. Everything was quite tasty, well seasoned. The beef was more tender-than-average. There's REAL ginger in there and plenty of it! Service was prompt and effective.

The soft background music was delivered by Vegas station Sunny 106.5 FM. Officially branded as Adult Contemporary, heavy on 80's and 90's up-tempo pop.  I heard Thriller (Michael Jackson), Wake Me Up Before You Go-Go (Wham!), Take On Me (a-ha), Never Gonna Give You Up (Rick Astley). That sort of thing. 

And the fortunes in my cookies were truly inspiring; my future has real hope! 

Sure to return!

CONCLUSIONS: Regarding non-casino, non-ACYE, dine-in Chinese in my general area, I am currently down for three venues: this one, Amlee (also reviewed) ... and (down in old-school, Water Street Henderson) Rose Garden (offering good lunch deals if you are in the neighborhood). 

I am still keeping an eye out for one of those classic, Mid-Century, red&black, heavily-Oriental-décored lux venues near me. My childhood in NYC spoiled me to such, I suppose. Haven't seen it yet!

In the meantime, these three aforementioned spaces are clean, nicely-appointed and present good food....
Absolutely love! The employees are always great to my husband and I. So welcoming, the portions are huge!! The shrimp lo mein is my favorite def recommend

Very plain food. The portions are large. The pork fried rice is excellent. I had beef and broccoli, which just didn't have that special Chinese flavor. It tasted like what I make at home in my unsuccessful quest to create great Chinese food. The decor was nice and classic, very retro Chinese. I would recommend this place as a good pick to take the great-grandparents.

Great Food. Great Service.

They remember what I order...right down to the side of sweet n' sour sauce and lack of onions in the beef and broccoli. 

The food is always piping hot and the lunch specials are fantastic and worth every penny. 

Things to get: Sweet n' Sour Chicken. Beef and Broccoli. Chicken and Broccoli (all white meat and very lean). Cream Cheese Wantons. Egg Drop Soup.

Things to avoid: Cashew Chicken (It just wasn't my favorite....though it's the only thing I've found there that I wasn't fond of.)

Another dicing adventure!

The die chose this restaurant from a long list of available locations.    A new place for us but we have been looking for some great chinese food, by we, I mean my friends and I.

Upon arrival, I was instructed by the die to get an appetizer of my choice, Fried shrimp--came out super hot and was fantastic!

My friend Gary tried a soda of our friend Polly's choice, he ordered a dr pepper.   She had to get an appetizer of the die's choice, it ordered some teriyaki beef sticks.   They were chewy but had good flavor.

The waiter brought us crab rangoon for free because we mentioned that we had never been there before and also the chef sent out some paper wrapped chicken for us-on the house as well!

One thing I love is that you order food here and its brought out on a plate and its HUGE portions and everyone can share and take what they like, some restaurants bring you individual portions which is ok but this is much better.

Booths were a bit lower so I sat on my foot to be even with everyone else but it was very clean and comfortable inside.  The waiter, Wilson I believe was his name was very attentive, he was friendly and kept coming over to check up on us, offering us refills as well.

The prices are AMAZING!

We ordered 3 drinks
3 appetizers
2 entrees
Rice and egg foo yung and all of that for $62!

Plus the 2 free items and the fortune cookies of course!

The bathroom as a bonus is Private which I love, call me strange if you havent already but I like a nice clean private bathroom   :)

We will be back soon!

I came here for the strawberry chicken, since that's a dish I seldom see at Chinese restaurants.  It was good; the chicken pieces were made of white meat with a crunchy outside, but the strawberry sauce wasn't as good as I've experienced elsewhere.  Still, I feel this is a quality restaurant, so I will be returning in time.

Small little place. Would have never thought to come here if my classmates didn't drag me there on our break between classes. Huge portions for the price you pay. Food tastes okay. Ordered the Kung Pap Shrimp & only got like 7 pieces and the rest was vegetables which was pretty disappointing. Overall okay food. Will probably be back if I'm craving Chinese food while at school.
Awesome staff so welcoming and friendly. Actually ended up giving us some extras which was so nice!  Food is great and portions are huge. Prices are good!

It's a reasonably appointed restaurant (glass over tablecloths), with above average food, in a nondescript if not run down strip shopping center at Russell and Pecos. Don't let the environs put you off. Service was decent and pleasant surprise: they have hot sake. It's an OK sake, but at $2 who's to complain? Also, they serve coke & pepsi for the non-alcoholic diners. This is now our favorite Chinese restaurant.
My favorite Chinese restaurant!  I drive all the way across town to eat here!  The best fried rice around. Huge lunch specials. And always friendly service. I've been coming here for years!

Wife and I had dinner after work I looked up what was nearby on yelp and went here. I had the chicken asparagus so good and wife had the cashew chicken which was tasty. When we went in and only another couple there but when we left the place was full. Prices are low so check it out if your in the area.

This is the 2nd time I've visited this restaurant and was just as impressed as the first time I came. All the food we had was super delicious and fresh. This is the best Chinese restaurant in Las Vegas. If you are in the mood for authentic Chinese food that won't disappoint, this is definitely the place to have it.

By far this is The Best Chinese food that we've had. Food is delicious, service is great, its a cute mom & pops restaurant and we will for sure come back. I wouldn't mind driving the 40 miles from my house to this place to get take out.

I don't know how I don't have a review on here already... maybe I'm just missing it? I don't know. 

Either way, this has become a regular go-to haunt for us. Let me explain - I am Asian and LOVE LOVE LOVE Asian foods while my husband is a picky white boy, who likes Asian foods, but not nearly as much or as frequently as I do. Luckly, we both like Golden Flower enough to eat here with a satisfying frequency for me without becoming an overdone schedule for him. Double bonus points!

The staff are all very friendly and attentive. For whatever reason, I always drink a TON of water at this place and I have never found myself asking where the refill was... it was always spot on and never did I run out. 

We are pretty regular here, so much so that we generally don't even get handed menu's anymore. Hubby usually always gets the sesame chicken and I alternate between also getting the sesame chicken or the black pepper chicken, with the black pepper being the current favorite. I also order a small cup of egg flower soup. 

The food always comes out quickly and very fresh. The portions are great! We both get two servings from our meals and it comes to about $23 (after tip). 

The lunch specials are a good deal, too. Great value for your meals at this place whether it's lunch or dinner. 

I have no complaints...

Since when was chowmein considered an entree? Apparently at this place. Most eateries offer it as well fried or steamed rice and then I get to pick an entree. they do have lunch specials,  or you can go a buck more for another list of lunch specials

Decent portions , that's a plus.
I would give this restaurant more stars if I could,  It is the best of the best.  Dont change your  quality of food,

Pretty tasteless Chinese "cuisine" that gave me the runs afterwards. Not really sure how it's been voted best of Vegas. Doesn't speak too highly for Vegas taste. But that's an oxymoron isn't it?
Inexpensive is about the only positive thing I can write about it.

I should have made a U-turn as soon as I saw the zodiac place mats and forks but no chopsticks on the tables.  Ordered Singapore style rice noodles to go, $10. The noodles were soggy, the shrimps tasteless, and the whole dish was a bland mushy mess.  Ugh.
Awesome little place to eat. Service and food was good, priced right. Extra large portions.

This is one of the best Chinese restaurants in the south part of the valley - There is a reason why this place has been voted the best of Las Vegas by the RJ for a few years. The service is great and the food is the best I have had in sometime ! Take out? Dine In? Take your pick - they make you feel at home either way!

Awesome Fried Shrimp!

A locals place!

Great service and low prices...

Yesterday was my second time there

Going back soon ( east of the Airport)
So good during a rush they are so sweet N super fast! Good Chinese neighborhood restaurant !

Looking for a great Chinese food restaurant in our neighborhood, VERY glad we found this one! Staff is very friendly and the customer service is wonderful! Try the steamed Tofu and Vegetables... light and delicious! Definitely a new fave!

Pretty solid Chinese delivery, especially considering the side of town they're on! 

My boyfriend and I ordered from here earlier and it was delicious. It took about 30-40 minutes for the food to arrive. We ordered the whole roast duck [a huge styrofoam takeout container stuffed with crispy-skinned, savory roast duck], the mongolian beef [a smokey, chile & green onion infused beef on top of crisped tiny noodles] and the appetizer platter [2 eggrolls- stuffed with cabbage but yummy, 2 fried shrimp- mushy and obviously frost bitten  and my least favorite thing, 2 'rangoons'- on the menu I ordered from online they were called 'shrimp puffs' but they were just wontons stuffed w/cream cheese and deep fried and 2 bbq pork ribs- the sauce was like a candy coating, crispy, caramelized and sweet with tender pork inside].

Overall the food was quite good, especially the duck. The skin was crisp and much of the fat had been rendered, leaving a tender and flavorful meat to gnaw at. The coating seemed hoisin based, but it was delicious! It came with a thick brown syrupy sauce to dunk, but I found the sauce worked well for the eggrolls as well. The eggrolls were crisp on the outside with moist, slightly-crunchy steamed cabbage. I liked the eggrolls as they were fairly light, despite being deepfried. The mongolian beef was a nice change of pace from the kind we usually get, served in thai restaurants. Often those versions have a lot of bell peppers and huge chunks of onion, while this version offered sauteed green onions and dried chiles, lending a more aromatic flavor and subtle texture. The tiny crisped noodles were a yummy touch, soaking up the soy-infused sauce oozing out of the beef. The pork ribs tasted candy coated from the thick sweet sauce that had hardened on the outside, but it contrasted well with the tender meat underneath. I'm no master of chinese-style bbq pork, however, so I'm not really qualified. ;} It was pretty tasty, though. The wontons were crisp, simple, snacky american-ized food. Tasty, but not something I would seek out again. They're so dastardly simple, it's almost embarassing to order them out. 

I would imagine the food isn't particularly authentic, but it's pretty yummy. It looks like they have some good lunch & dinner deals for cheap, so it's a good option if you're in the neighborhood. I look forward to trying more of their items!

Also, the portion sizes are ginormous. We payed $45.13 for our order, but we'll get at least 6 meals out of it [or 3 for the boy and i each

Red state Chinese (yup they've got the horoscope place mats) in a worn hole in the wall in a strip mall. But huge portions of well prepared grub and excellent prices. Great value, and some talent in the kitchen.

I was craving chinese food one night after work. I always pass by this place on the way to work to so gave it a shot and came one night to order some dinner. 

General Tso's Chicken $9

Vegetable Chop Suey $7

I can definitely say that I was surprised by 1) the portion size and 2) how good the food tasted. The general tso's chicken was the best version of the dish I ever tasted. It had a good balance of sweet and hot but still with a crispy batter. The vegetables were good too. I will be back again to try some other dishes and I'm glad they deliver.

Ate here several times over the last few weeks.I have had kung pao chicken,kung pao shrimp,chicken with broccoli,chicken with asparagus.Everything was delicious,the service is fast and friendly.The portions are generous and prices are reasonable.Great lunch specials for 5.95 and 6.95.

This is my second time here in 2 weeks. Both times the food was hot fresh and amazing. The Generals chicken is perfectly fried.  The best part is the lo mein has the freshest vegetables. This is our new go-to spot for Chinese.

Ordered delivery from Golden Flower for the first time tonight and it didn't disappoint! They quoted 45 minutes but arrived in less than 30. Our order was correct: sesame chicken, bbq pork chow mein, and mongolian beef. Rice, soy sauce, and fortune cookies were included. Pretty standard Chinese, not much to say other than we thought everything was great and we'll definitely order again in the future.

I had to find a new Chinese place since I changed jobs and my usual go to place was no longer on my way home from work. I had noticed the (small) sign about 3 months into my new commute and put it on my must try list. After trying a few other places that didn't pass my chicken fried rice test I wasn't too sure about trying another place. I am glad that I finally just on impulse stopped one day after work for a to go order.
I was greeted quickly and they were very friendly. I placed my order and after about a 5 minute wait my order was ready. Reasonable prices. Great fried rice. This is my new go to place!

I have come here for lunch at least once a month ever since our first visit. I love the lunch specials and the food is outstanding. I get the chow mien, beef and broccoli, or vegetable supreme, depending on my mood.
This place has amazing food.  It is always fresh and great service..  I have visited several times and I have never been disapointed.
Very good food! Their service was awesome and im from california! Definitely will come back.

Dangit! Closed until July 30! I wish I'd called before the long drive to get here, based solely on the reviews!! 

I'll update my review when/if I come back.

By far the best Chinese food on the Eastside, but not the best in the city. I have ordered carry out from here multiple times and can usually order it on my way to picking it up and the food is already for me when I get there (10-15 minutes consistently). I have ordered nearly everything off the chicken part of the menu, and have never been disappointed. Delicious egg drop/flower soup (no corn in it, which is a plus for me). Staff are always incredibly polite and efficient. I'd definitely recommend this place if you're too lazy to go to Chinatown.

Had the lunch special, had the general Tso chicken and it was great, The lunch special also includes an egg roll, crunchy noodles with duck sauce and spicy mustard and either BBQ pork fried rice or steamed rice. It was ready in minutes. you pay standing in the middle of the room so kinda akward for some I would guess.

Ok here comes a "Vegas Baby" history moment.... 

I have been coming to this hidden gem for over 20 years. I don't go as often after the original family sold to the present owners.

 If you are long time fan you will remember the beautiful Grandma sitting at the end booth by the kitchen, who would get up and greet every customer with the warmest smile. It was a true family restaurant and won the RJ Best of Las Vegas  because of the hospitality, and of course the best tasting Chinese Food around.

My family misses them to this day, and still talks about how wonderful the restaurant was. 

The new owners have done a good job keeping to the original recipes but it lacks a little on taste and a little on the old hospitality. 

All in all I highly recommend giving them a try.

I like their lunch specials they start at 5.95 and have a lot to chose from. 

Today I was unhappy with my choice I ordered BBQ pork chow mein to much sauce and was over seasoned with garlic I will never order that again YUCK super nasty! 

Other items on the menu are good so I gave them 3 stars.
This is our go to for takeout Asian food.  Priced well and abundant serving sizes. They are very friendly and give extras periodically. Look for the coupon on the menu. Delivery is quick as well.

Hadn't been here for years.  It had always been an excellent place for Chinese food.  Landed at airport and went here for dinner.  We ordered 3 entrees and all were delicious.  Serving portions are huge.  We had lots to take home.  Service was great with pleasant servers.  Will definitely be back again.

I must say this restaurant was a very pleasant surprise. It is now a once or twice a week stop for us. For those that say it is not authentic, I disagree. I am half Chinese & the cuisine served here is pretty traditional Cantonese. Comments referencing not enough spice need to frequent a Schezwan Chinese restaurant or request their dish  be made extra spicy. 
In the last month I have ordered the following :
Asparagus Chicken
Chicken wth snow peas
Lemon Chicken with steamed broccoli ($1 extra)
Sesame chicken " " "
Kung Pao Chicken
All came with a choice of egg drop or hot & sour soup. I had hot & sour. Also comes with egg roll & fried wonton. Normally I have steamed white rice with Chinese, as that is how we ate growing up. But after tasting my BF's pork fried rice, I started ordering it also. It was much like my mom makes, cabbage, onion, a few bean sprouts, light fluffy rice. Excellent. No peas & carrots, that's Americanized...lol...
HUGE portions, fresh food, outstanding service. Yes the ambiance is lacking. But it is very clean & charming in a funky way. It is very good food & an enjoyable little spot.
I recommend, a dozen times here & consistently good.

The white rice was good and so was the broth the war won ton soup was in. However the dumplings we're weird cause the noodles it was wrapped in was more like for pasta not the norm rice noodles that dumplings are wrapped in. The war wonton Soup comes with noodles. It straight up looked like ramen noodles boiled. 
The spring rolls we not springy but super greasy and just filled with fried lettuce.

Its not 5 star worthy in my opinion but definitely lives up to 4. The customer service is great very kind and attentive. Their soups are actually super good here! I can appreciate the no msg and also that they use real fresh meat(some places idk wtf it is there serving).  There general tso and orange chicken are amazing. Only downside is some dishes are kinda lacking the wow factor.
But you can't beat there lunch special, fair price and good portion.

One of my favorite spots for Chinese food in Vegas. Hadn't been in a few years as I had moved but now back and glad to see it's here and great as always. Nothing super fancy but excellent food and great service.  Try the Po Po Platter and a glad of plum wine with a friend!  Yum!

Checked this place out randomly with a friend and it was quiet and nice during our visit. I think they had the best orange chicken I've ever had so that's a win.  If you want Chinese food in a smallish, peaceful restaurant I'd recommend.

I grew up in Southern California where there were a bunch of Chinese hole in the wall restaurants. So this place is nostalgic for me and brings back memories. This is a solid 3.5 for me. 

From the moment you walk in, the decor is a little on the older side. The ladies serving us were friendly towards us, but we're very strict to each other when it came to work. They were very efficient and almost robotic when it came to taking orders, bringing out food and clearing plates. 

As for the food, it's more about the memories than the taste. If it means something, everything was fried fresh, hot and was crispy. The food was super oily, super salty and made me feel like a blimp afterwards. But you know what?! I grew up eating this stuff so I loved every bit of it. Thank goodness for the gym though. 

If this location were in a nicer area, it probably would have gotten a 4 star rating. I don't know when I would be back again, but now I know where to get the greasy Chinese food I sometimes crave.

Came here last night with my mom around 7:30 or so. Fairly small place with kick-ass Chinese food. Maybe 12 booths and 6 tables. 

We decided to share a popo platter and a war wonton soup. I thought we would need to order an entree after that but boy was I mistaking. 

The server immediately brought us fried noodles, sweet sauce and hot mustard with our waters. 

The popo platter was served in a round two level platter with the top level lit like a very tiny grill that held 2 skewers of beef. The lower level had two spring rolls, two, giant BBQ ribs, two paper wrapped chicken, two large fried shrimp, and four cream cheese rangoons. Everything was exceptionally delicious and I thoroughly enjoyed it. 

The war wanton soup was huge and jam packed with goodies and not over powered with just vegetables. The meat was perfect and the shrimp was delicious as was the broth. 

Needless to say, I ate until I was pleasantly full and their was still some left over for mom to take to lunch. The best part...our bill was under $20.00. 

I will return here and look forward to trying many things on the reasonably priced menu. I also noticed as we walked in a chalkboard that listed about 10 entrees on special. But most everything was under 10.00. 

Several of our friends and my moms boss eat here regularly. I can understand why. Wonderful food, great wait staff and relaxing environment.
Excellent food, friendly, attentive service and the prices are very good. I had the shrimp friend rice, my wife had the spicy shrimp with vegetables, and it was all delicious.

The food and service are very good.
I'm impressed!


This was a ton of sesame chicken for  8.45.

This used to be my fav spot 3 years ago. don't know what happened to them but last month i ordered lemon chicken and found a piece of glass in it.  I called to complained but suddenly no one spoke english. Today:
I ordered cashew chicken.  I found a shrimp tail in it.  At first I thought it was a cockroach wing, but no after totally examining it, I have decided for the sake of my sanity and health its a shrimp tail.  I hate seafood. I will not be eating here anymore.
First time and  loved it! Bomb!  shrimp chow mein and great lunch special and great customer service will be back soon!!!

I've been going here for a while now and this is the ONLY Chinese place I go to now! It's a little hidden in this kind of vacant shopping center on Russell and Pecos but its definitely a hidden gem.
I got my entire family addicted and tell everyone I know about it haha. You can tell the ingredients are super fresh and they give you really generous portions! 
I'm stuck on the orange chicken because you can actually taste fresh oranges, not some weird overly concentrated fake orange flavoring. Lunch specials range from $6.95-$7.95 and come with soup, and fried rice. 
Waitresses are super friendly and drinks are never left empty. Definitely one of my favorite places.
Lunch specials are 5.95 and 6.95, they use only white meat. Great service.
This is a typical traditional Chopsuy restaurant. Ingredients are fresh, portions are good, not very expensive. Good enough for neighborhood restaurant but not an updated Chinese cuisines.

One of my favorite Chinese restaurants in Henderson, go there for lunch often. Great delivery service and friendly delivery guy. BUT today was a different story, we went in to have lunch and we got the GRUMPY, NO personality waitress. She basically ignored our table and was bothered anytime we did flag her down and asked for something. The other 2 in our party of 3 got tea refills but she ignored my request and didn't even bat an eye my way. I'm tired of always getting  that bitchy no personality waitress. If it wasn't for the food being so good I would not return. It's the waitress without the glasses.

Exceptional service, exceptional food, exceptional prices!   No kidding, this is my absolute favorite Chinese restaurant and I have tried uncountable Chinese restaurants and this one is top of the list.  They are friendly, they are attentive,  and the food is really enjoyable.  Try the silver wrapped chicken for an appetizer.  Prices are good too.   This is a hidden gem.  I hesitate to write a good review because I want to be sure to get a seat when I am in town but these folks have earned it!

You probably get the most bang for your buck eating here. You pay about the equivalent of what you would pay at the leading Chinese fast food restaurant, yet the food is 10x better. Lunch specials are very delicious and includes soup as well! Unlike most dine-in Chinese restaurants, refills are free as well! Staff is very polite too!

The food was good! However, Before we were done eating they wanted us to pay the bill! Then came back to check to make sure we paid the bill before the took the receipt! This will be my last time here! If you're going to go here do yourself a favor and get your food To Go!!!!

Food is not bad, service was pleasant and timely, but nothing exceptional.  I went there based on the 4 star review from Yelp and was a little let down.  It's very similar to just about every other Chinese restaurant out there.

Wonderful food, generous portions, good prices, prompt service, large variety of dishes, and friendly ladies! It's located right around the corner from me and I will find myself here a couple times a week. Laid-back inside atmosphere...definitely would recommend a visit. They have cheap lunch & family specials as well!

Came here with some family because they wanted chinese food.  We ordered the dinner specal and there was a ton of food and it was really good.  They have a veggie soup that was really good.  There egg rolls were hot and fresh but a little oily but still really tasty.  We got sweet and sour chicken and something else and a beef dish and they were all really tasty.

I've been coming here for the better part of a decade, and have never been disappointed. Fast, fresh, and inexpensive. My only beef is the strawberry chicken isn't served during lunch. Four stars due the water downed sweet and sour sauce and the servers always seem like they'd rather be elsewhere, they're polite, but it's all so automatic. Also, maybe an update on the dining room and dishes.

Been looking for a good place. We took out from here about a year ago and it was so so, we decided to give it another try and this time dine in. We were not disappointed we ordered the lunch specials cashew chicken and chicken chop suey, wow I must say we had enough leftovers for the next day. I did order a side of fried shrimp and was pleasantly surprised the shrimp were huge and not at all greasy. We will definitely be back.
This is the spot to go to . If your craving some good Chinese food this is the place to go . Amazing food amazing staff .
Great food Great prices they even gave us a plate of foil wrapped ck cause all of us 4 cks in on party of 7 people spent 60 dollars...was worth it will be back.....
I searched & searched for good Chinese food in Las Vegas and I finally thought I found it. Unfortunately this is just decent Chinese Food.

I ordered a variety of things to go.   The order was ready when they said and the waitress was nice and quick and the food was packed well as not drip in the car.

The Beef with green beans was good.  No weird fat bits and the flavor was good.  Not spicy.

The Kung Pow chicken was flavorful, but should have been spicy as it had the pepper icon by it.  So, not the best.

The Chicken Chow Mein was awful.  There was nothing wrong with the chicken.  It was weird looking, but tasted good and no weird texture.  I think they must pound it first so it looks different than usual.  The noodles were the average type used, but the sauce they used on it just tasted awful.  I have had Chow Mein in no less than 30 places in my life and they usually taste pretty similar and are a almost sweet soy flavor.  This was just bad.  Won't order it again.  There is a place in the shopping center at Serene & Eastern near a German Bakery that is much better all around.
I was hoping this was going to be good since it was much closer to my house.

The food is not super fancy, not super good really, but you won't be let down either.
The atmosphere is just run on the mill and kind of a dive joint if you know what I mean.
You will have to give the service a A+, they are prompt and attentive. There is a older couple that will cater to your every need and do the best they can to make sure you are happy.
That being said, you just can't give them a bad review, they care about their restaurant and the people that come in to dine there.
The food is a step above Panda Express, but not totally awful either. Once again, such quaint service makes you feel good dining there. Nice people.
Fed both my wife and myself for under 12 dollars with leftovers! Great food at amazing prices!

This is a great little classic Chinese spot.  Small dining area but don't let that fool you on the portion sizes.  Brought the aunties here and they loved it.  Inexpensive and fresh.  The service was great.  Its only downfall was the size and dated decor, but other than that AWESOME. The sweet and sour chicken was perfectly fried and the side items were super tasty.

Situated in a decaying and desolate shopping plaza, this hole-in-the-wall restaurant proves to be a hidden GEM that's a must-try. I've lived in Vegas for almost 20 years and thanks to yelp reviews, just barely became aware of this little place's existence that's practically a hop and a skip away from my neighborhood.

I've only gone in for lunch, but their specials are unequivocally unrivaled. Ranging between $5.95 and $6.95, you get the most bang for your buck with your choice of entree (I always get the shrimp chow mein - the shrimps are so plump, too) accompanied with your choice of sweet+sour or egg flower soup, plain or fried rice, a spring roll, and a cream cheese rangoon. And the portions are a-plenty. Lunch for two with drinks is easily attainable for around $20, tip included.

The place itself looks unassuming. Inside, I love the small, cozy feel and the booths that line the walls. The service depends - the very first time, our waitress was just okay. The second time, our waitress was attentive, refilling my iced green tea like, 3 times. (it's the best!)

Quality-wise, I'd say it's definitely a few notches up from Panda Express, but still wavering underneath some of the more "authentic" Chinese places in Chinatown, but for the value and portion, it's a clear winner.

A little ways away from Chinatown I thought oh boy....but pleasantly surprised. Good Chinese food and for the price great portions. Shrimp fried rice was excellent. General Tso and Orange chicken was good. Wanted to try the braised shrimp but I guess the waitress didn't understand. The atmosphere was cozy and would go back.

THANK YOU YELP!  This establishment has become my only Go To for Chinese in all of Las Vegas.  I have eaten at many other places, this is the one I come back to. The war wonton is out of this world good.  I also love the Po Po (pu pu or Poo Poo, depending on region you are from) platter.  I am not a fan of the Pork spare rib so we switch it out for extra egg rolls.  Usually my spouse and I will order wor wonton soup and split it, a po po platter for 2, and 1 entree with fried rice to split.  Every entree we have had has been exceptional.  Black pepper chicken, chicken with asparagus, sizzling beef, lemon chicken, Moo shu ANYTHING.  This is the place to eat.  I cannot say enough good things about the food served here.  I hope you go, and enjoy it.

We just moved to Vegas from Phoenix. I must say I'm pretty impressed. We typically try and find the best Chinese place and so far this has everyone else beat. The to go portions are a lot bigger then usual. Good quality food too. A must try if u want good quality.

One word - Tasty!!

Now, I don't want to give anyone the wrong impression when I describe the Golden Flower.  It's not the best or most authentic Chinese food you will ever eat.  You will not find an overly-friendly wait staff.  What you will find is a business that caters to the local lunch crowd, and they are damn good at it!

Lunch specials range in price from $6-$9. Specials include choice of soup, choice of rice, an egg roll and a cream-cheese rangoon.  Definitely try the pork fried rice. You will be pleased. I also recommend trying any shrimp dish.  The shrimp is always plump and flavorful. 

The staff does a good job of getting you in and out fast. Sometimes the entree will arrive before you finish your soup. But the staff is not trying to get rid of you. They just serve the food immediately as it leaves the kitchen, which is great if you need to get back to work, but give it a minute to cool before digging in.

Just to let you know, the Golden Flower has survived in the same location for 20 years while every other surrounding business has at one time or another had to close it's doors.  That's a testament to how good they are at what they do, and they have done it consistently for a very long time.

In a town with a tradition of imploding old casinos to make way for new ones, it's always nice to visit a local haunt that hasn't changed over the span of a generation. Don't ever change, Golden Flower. Don't you ever change.

FYI - There is a surcharge when paying with a bank card for totals under $10. Also, ask for the check when you're ready. They won't always bring it automatically.
Been going here over 10 years.  Best Chinese in the neighborhood and a great value.

Wish this place was as good as their window advertising says it is. However their food wasn't nothing exciting. Ordered the veggie egg rolls, chicken fried rice, and the lemon chicken. The lemon chicken (which used to be a chicken breast) was just breaded chicken nuggets that tasted nothing at all like lemon. The egg rolls were filled with just cabbage and over cooked. Of what we ordered I would recommend the chicken fried rice. It was tasty and had plenty of chicken to go with the rice and cooked well. I give this place only two stars for the Chicken fried rice, prices and selection of food choices.Since we order take out, I plan on eating in next time. Maybe it will be all they advertise to be.

This place is super good and authentic. Right when I entered i was greeted. I came for lunch and decided to order the string beans with chicken. It came with egg roll, crag wonton, either bbq pork fried rice or steam rice. The food was so flavorful and the string beans had a nice crunch cooked to perfection. The restaurant could probably be cleaned up a bit. Seem like it needed a vacuum. The portions were very generous. All for 5.95. Definitely will be back!

Yelp you didn't fail us here everything was great we split the orange chicken and the moo shu pork with the combination added the fried rice the egg rolls soup and entres were all excellent the food quality blew jasmine at belligo out of the water.
There is reason why Golden Flower has been voted number one in Las Vegas. All Chinese restaurants should learn from Golden Flower. I had General Tao chicken. All i can say is "Culinary Orgasim."
Great food and great service.  The Food is fresh made no sitting under heat lamps waiting for you to order, and taste incredible will definitely be visiting this great place again and again.

I would seriously avoid this place. I went here based off of reviews. We ordered fried shrimp appetizer. About 10 minutes later the waitress dropped off a plate with shrimp and egg rolls. My husband pointed at the egg rolls and asked what they were, and in the mean time I picked up one of the shrimp and was bringing it to my mouth. The waitress heard him and said "oh I made a mistake put it down" so I put the shrimp down and she picked up the plate a dropped it off at the booth next to ours! And acted like nothing was wrong with that! Needless to say the people at the tables across from us saw what happened and were completely disgusted too. If they do that in front of customers I can't imagine what they do in the kitchen. Also there is no air conditioning in this place so they have 2 fans going in the dining area which don't help much. Channel 13 dirty dining or the health district really need to check out this place.

Best Chinese food in Vegas, my family has ate here for years and always get fresh tasty food served to us. I recommend the salt n pepper pork chops, Mongolian beef, strawberry chicken, won ton soup, beef n broccoli and fried rice. Everything comes made to order. Restaurant is clean, staff friendly and service fast. Even on busy nights you get a good meal and service.

This place is excellent. Their portions are big for what you pay and you can call it in and pick it up or they also have tables inside. Love the Mongolian beef and their BBQ pork fried rice is bangin. There's also a family arcade place next door

I was in the mood for some "real" Chinese food and of course went to yelp for help.  I looked over the list and notice this place and the great reviews it had.  I found a menu on line and placed an order.  I ordered the family meal "c" for two.  I figured we would be getting two of the small white take-out containers, so I also added an additional main course of orange chicken.  The order arrived within 30 minutes and I was Shocked at the size of the full bags we received!!  You would have thought we were feeding 6-8 people!!!  I could not believe how much food there was.  I opened the soup first and saw tons of veggies, meat and won tons, so much that it was more of a meal then a soup and tasted great.  We opted to wait on it and dig into the main dishes.  The orange chicken was very good, as was the sweet and sour shrimp.  I was not as happy with the Mongolian beef, but it was still good.  The best of the house fried rice.  Huge amount and loaded, very tasty.  I also really loved the paper wrapped chicken, which I didn't even order and received. (thank you)  This will be my go to Chinese from now on.  Thanks Golden Flower and thanks yelp!!!

$5.95 lunch special! You can't beat it
I give it five stars because the service was prompt, my take-out order took no more than 5 min (as promised, even though the restaurant looked busy), and the food was good. It's hard to mess up Chinese food but they did a good job and gave big portions.

This place is always amazing. I love that they deliver. I've been going to Golden Flower for the past 10 years and nothing has changed. The pot stickers are some of the best in town. I have not ever ordered anything that wasn't great. They take great care of their customers!! You can't go wrong with this place!

After reading reviews on this place, we decided to make the 25 minute trip here. We are in from LOs Angeles, so we didn't know where to go for Chinese food. We got there sign on window says this place was voted best for 2013. I'm not sure why?  We ordered egg flower soup, chicken chow main and chicken with pea pods. After my initial hunger feeling was gone I tasted the chow main and that was disgusting. I ate the pea pods, then my stomach started hurting so I stopped eating. My husband had the same reaction. We asked fo the check and the waitress was like you want a box? No thank you. 

Now were driving, chewing gum to get rid of that bad taste. Never again. 
Same reason I stopped eating Panda Express the quality and taste.

Fantastic food!  Friendly staff. I love this place.  It is by far my favorite Chinese restaurant in town. The portions are great. I LOVE the usage of all white meat chicken.  It is definitely a hidden gem.

"After being on a cross country flight from Fort Lauderdale to Las Vegas to meet up with my brother and a week on vacationing on the Strip, I was anxious to see a real locals restaurant. My brother drove me to a nice Chinese restaurant in a happening Von's shopping center called Golden Flower. " In reality if Yelp was in existence ten years ago in the summer of 2014 this is how I would of started the review. Golden Flower Chinese Restaurant holds a place in my heart because it is one of if not the first locals Chinese restaurant that I visited in Las Vegas when I was living in Fort Lauderdale ten years ago. For at least ten years Golden Flower has been blooming in the very injured shopping center at the corner of Pecos and Russell Roads. Where this shopping centers Von's, Denny's, New York Bagel shop, Starbuck's, and so on rest in peace, the spirit of Golden Flower Chinese Restaurant is alive. 

  It was yesterday before I attended the Alcohol Awareness Training class that I wanted to take advantage of a nearby Chinese Restaurant luncheon special. After a near decade hiatus, I was returning to Golden Flower Chinese Restaurant. 

  Golden Flower is still the same cozy Chinese restaurant as I remember back when the Outcasts "Hey ya" was topping the charts. It brings back further memories of the cozy Chinese restaurants in Long Island, New York. The oldies from the 1980s and 1990s added to the relaxing environment. Listening to the acoustic version of "Hotel California" made each bite of the shrimp chow mein that much more enjoyable. 

  More than the cozy environment and music, the service left me with a better taste of the Golden Flower. From the time I stepped inside to when I paid, Christie was very welcoming. She invited me to sit at any table in the relatively small dining room that was sparsely populated by diners. She was on top of refills and would always say, "Thank you." Ultimately she never rushed me. I'd overhear a couple of customers thank Christie for the great service. 

  The luncheon specials are a good deal. They are in affect Monday to Saturday from 11 am to 3 pm. In similar style to the luncheon specials throughout the Las Vegas Valley the price is between $5.95 and $6.95. the reality is that when you add a glass of Coke, tip, and tax it comes out to the figure of $11. But the Coke could be unnecessary because I vividly recall the delicious hot tea here. Let me talk more about the lunch specials. They include either egg drop or hot and sour soup. But, if you love wonton soup like I do, it is $2.25 per person. There is more. The lunch special also includes an egg roll, crunchy noodles with duck sauce and spicy mustard and either BBQ pork fried rice or steamed rice. The lunch special features an entree. The choices include numerous styles of chow mein, pepper steak, curry chicken, and sweet and sour chicken (I posted a picture of the menu in this business listing). 

   I ordered the shrimp chow mein luncheon special. The crunchy noodles were decent. I am a fan of the wide noodles and not the skinny ones they serve here. Regardless they went good with the spicy mustard. Before I could get more acquainted with the noodles, Christie placed the hot and sour soup on the white tablecloth. The soup tasted hot and sour. The next visit I intend to pay the $2.25 for the wonton soup. The egg roll which reminded me of a spring roll was Panda Express allright. Now the portion of the shrimp chow mein with fried rice was enormous. The quality was magnificent. In a couple of my previous reviews on Las Vegas Chinese Restaurants I voice my opinion that the chow mein noodles are filler food. Golden Flower serves flavorful chow mein that hint of lo mein sprinkled with generous amounts of chunky juicy appetizing shrimp and sprinklers of onions. This is an example of both quantity and quality. The Best of Las Vegas has bestowed Golden Flower with The Best of Vegas awards in 2002, 2008, and 2012.

  In hindsight, I am cognizant of the fact that somethings stay the same. In the period of a decade Golden Flower is still the same local Chinese Restaurant serving remarkable Chinese food luncheon specials in a cozy environment. In the period of a decade I remain a fan of Golden Flower.

This is my favorite Chinese restaurant. Huge portions and you can make it a combination with fried rice, an eggroll and egg drop soup. Normally I'm not a big rice person but their fried rice is AMAZING.

The waitresses are so nice every time and I love stopping by after a rough day for some comfort food.

First impression: Meh. I switched jobs and have been looking for new places to try for lunch. Based on Yelp reviews from people who are usually spot on with their reviews I decided to give Golden Flower a try. 

Service: A+. Attentive, service with a smile, no complaints. 
Location: B: It's not in a part of town I usually go to so it's a lunch only place for me. 
Food: After eating Chinese food for over 3 decades now I like to think I know if something's good, or if it's not. My standard order when trying a new Chinese place is Kung Pao Chicken. It's a good dish for me to judge the quality of the food because I can see how much attention is paid to their food prep, if they are stingy or generous with the spices, and if the cooks in the kitchen are paying attention to what they're doing. 

The Kung Pao Chicken I had today for lunch was boring. It had some peppers tossed in, but it lacked flavor. It was definitely better than anything Panda could ever serve, but I've had a lot better Kung Pao Chicken at several other places around the valley than I did at Golden Flower. 

The lunch special included soup, a cream cheese wonton, and an egg roll. I barely ate 1/4 of the soup, but I was not a fan of it. Flavorless it what comes to mind when I think of it. The cream cheese wonton was smashed almost flat, and looked like it was an afterthought, tossed on the plate and then forgotten about. And the egg roll tasted like what you would find in the frozen food section at the grocery store. It was blah and just tasted off to me. 

For the price it's not bad, but I've had much, much better for the same price elsewhere. Will I go back? Yes, because I may have picked an off day for them and the second time could be better. But my first impression is truly meh....I arrived thinking Yelp was going to lead me to something special, but I left disappointed.

Perfect hole in the wall Chinese. My husband and I  started eating here at least 10 years ago, when I started working at the vons that was in the shopping center. We enjoyed this place. Really great lunch specials with large portions. It also comes with egg roll and rice. Small and quiet atmosphere which I loved. Very clean and fast service. I order their lunch specials quite often, which are very cheap (around 5-6 bucks), and give you a lot of food. 
My favorite dishes are the hong kong style crispy noodles, and the honey walnut shrimp. My roommate usually orders their orange chicken, which seems boring, but golden flower's version is very good. 
Their chow mein is also very good, always serving with a lot of meat and veggies. 
Their staff is very good, and have stayed open later than needed several times to make me my food

Great Asian food is impossible to find in Vegas...even good Asian food is extremely hard to find.  I will admit that after 20 years out here this place is about as good I have been able to find.

Small. .. quick.... traditional Chinese... amazing food.  service was awesome. .prices super affordable,  $29  for 4 people ...enough said... we will come back when we are on vacation!

If you love Chinese food as much as you, you will consider this place when dining out. The food is REALLY good here, and the prices are awesome as well. I will be coming here again in the future. 
P.S. the BBQ pork & chicken fried rice was SO GOOD.

I'm honestly TRYING to think of a reason I should possibly take off a star, and I can't find one. I've never been inside but my husband and I order delivery from this place all the time and each time our food is delivered quickly, hot, fresh, and delicious with friendly service. 

The very first time we ever ordered from here, they got our address wrong and ended up in Henderson. When they finally figured out what had happened, they called us immediately to apologize and let us know that the delivery driver was returning to the restaurant to pick up a fresh batch of food for us. We understood the mistake so we were not angry and were actually just happy that they were keeping us informed. When the delivery guy finally gets to our house, he apologizes again and tells us that our food is free because of their mistake! We've been loyal customers ever since.

Excellent food + great customer service = 5 stars

Arrived an hour after opening today and was greeted by a young hostess who seated my mother and I quickly to a booth. The ambience and area was nice, dining lights not too bright and had the Chinese-American family dining environment. 
I grew up in Southern Cali so the place gave me subtle nostalgia such as the decorated serving plates and red color coordination used in Chinese restaurant decorum.
We were given two types of menu, the daily special lunch menu and the regular for ala carte along with a gentleman giving us a starter appetizer of small bowl of crispy restaurant style noodles and dual dipping sauce of red sweet and mustard spicy sauce. Since its my first visit, I always start small and ordered the most loved dishes first. I ordered the Walnut Shrimp and Chicken Chop Suey. 
It was 15 minutes and we were served our first entree of Chicken Chop suey and a bowl of rice in which the gentleman kindly served it on our plates. This is something very normal in Chinese traditional restaurants where the server will automatically put rice and/or other foods on to your plate before you dig in. 
The chicken entree was fresh off the wok because I tasted that fire wok hay from the tasty pieces of crunchy vegetables, very tender and succulent chicken. Mmmmm.  Lol now mind you, this isn't the type of white sauce chop suey, since some meats served in a veggie dish is commonly stir fried with a brown sauce instead.
When the walnut shrimp arrived, I had to be ready. Plump (fat sized) and lightly battered crisp shrimps with tail on on a bed of shredded cabbage and topped with a sauce of the famed mayo-honey creation; garnished with steamed broccolis, this was nice. The treasure of that entree was sprinkled with sweet/toasted walnuts! When I bit into the shrimp and walnut, the tasty morsels melted in my mouth and it was divine. The strong sweetness of the candied walnut blended very well with the tartness of the sauce. It was heaven. Omg. Lol
Anyways, my mother and I finished our lunch satisfied and gulped down a glass of icy water with a wedge of lemon. It was a wonderful lunch that wasn't heavy or ladled with salt. 
We thanked our hostess and left smiling to go on about our day! I would definitely return to try more of their signature dishes soon!

It was Chinese New Year, and the place was packed!   Probably not an easy day for the restaurant staff.  And there were problems from the outset.

Starting off, congealed Sweet & Sour Sauce stuck to two pages of my menu.  Promised hot water for tea was forgotten, and so was my entire order of Chicken Chow Mein.  Fried Rice came late.  And there were no paper towels in the men's restroom.

The food that did arrive was very good though.  My party of four enjoyed very good Pot Stickers, Three Flavored Sizzling Rice Soup without pork, Chicken Chow Mein, Beef with Pea Pods, and Walnut Shrimp.  And, for the second time some mains arrived in shifts rather than all diners being served at the same time.  When servers are not harried by waiting on large crowds, and pay attention to details, eating Cantonese fare here can be an enjoyable and tasty dining experience.  

I will hope for noticeable improvement, and call here again another day.

This place the best. Delivery dude is awesome, the folks in the restaurant are awesome. These are people who really care about their craft. The food is excellent; there's a reason they've been voted Best in Vegas a billion times. Can't recommend this place enough if you're craving Chinese food, did I mention they deliver?

It is time for an update, I stay a fan of Golden Flower as they have been consistently great over the years! I have tried many menu items and they are all delicious! High quality food at great reasonable prices so you will never leave hungry!

We always take leftovers because they are generous in portion size!

The staff is always very friendly and on point with drink refills.

I drive across town to eat here, it is totally worth it and I crave it when hankering for excellent chinese food!

The "Famous" Las Vegas movie and show stars even come and eat here it is so good, a hidden gem in Las Vegas for many years!

You MUST check it out if you like really good mandarin/cantonese style chinese food! They deliver also but I prefer to dine in and enjoy the experience!
